name: Avoid too many SQL calls for methods with high fan-in
description:
This rule identifies client-side control elements that embed a number of data resource access actions that exceed a threshold value.

The threshold for the number of data queries is a parameter and can be changed at will. The default value is 2.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
Software that does not leverage database capabilities to efficiently run data processing (such as stored procedures and functions) requires excessive computational resources.
When the artifacts have a high fan-in the risk is highly increased.
reference:
http://it-cisq.org/
ASCPEM 1.0, Automated Source Code Performance Efficiency Measure, Object Management Group.
CISQ: ASCPEM-PRF-10
remediation: Use dedicated stored procedures when multiple data accesses are needed.
total: Number of artifacts with SQL access and high fan-in
alternativeName: Avoid too many SQL calls for methods with high fan-in

qualityStandards.name: Non-SQL Named Callable and Method Control Element with Excessive Number of Data Resource Access
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Detection of occurrences of this pattern helps decrease software resource waste by the existence of software elements requiring too many data access outside of the data manager.

Consequence
Software that does not leverage database capabilities to efficiently run data processing (such as stored procedures and functions) requires excessive computational resources

qualityStandards.name: Non-SQL Invokable Control Element with Excessive Number of Data Resource Accesses
qualityStandards.description: The software contains a client with a function or method that contains a large number of data accesses/queries that are sent through a data manager, i.e., does not use efficient database capabilities.
